title: 10 things I learnt from listening to the women who accused Harvey Weinstein
text:
They could barely get through the opening sponsors video before the audience was cheering and applauding wildly. The reason: before them on the stage sat six women who, between them, had broken the cult of silence that bind so many women and are trying to change a system that so often seems rigged in favour of powerful men.

Jodi Kantor and Meghan Twohey are the New York Times reporters who broke the sexual abuse allegations against Harvey Weinstein in 2017, kick-started the #MeToo movement and have just published a book She Said, about the investigation.
